remarks.format:

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapTime Parse(string value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Converts the specified into a object.
Docs.returns: A object that is obtained from .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapTime.Parse%2A> method is capable of parsing strings in the HH:mm:ss.fffzzz format. This is composed out of the following format patterns.
|Format Pattern|Description|Examples| |--------------------|-----------------|--------------| |HH|The hour within a 24-hour range. Single-digit hours have a leading zero.|17, 07| |mm|The minute. Single-digit minutes have a leading zero.|49, 05| |ss|The second. Single-digit seconds have a leading zero.|32, 02| |fff|The fraction of a second. A maximum of 7 fraction digits are allowed, and only the first three are parsed.|321635, 4592| |zzz|The full time zone offset (hour and minutes) from the Universal Time Coordinate (Greenwich Mean Time). Single-digit hours have a leading zero.|-07:00, +08:00, Z|
Only the first 3 fraction digits are parsed because the parsed value is stored as a <xref:System.DateTime> object, and the <xref:System.DateTime> type supports precisely 3 fraction digits of accuracy.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use this method. This code example is part of a larger example that is provided for the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapTime> class.
[!code-cpp[System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapTime#11](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapTime/CPP/demo.cpp#11)] [!code-csharp[System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapTime#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapTime/CS/demo.cs#11)]

Docs.exception: does not contain a date and time that corresponds to any of the recognized format patterns.
